  16. (* Definition of variables used by built-in actions *)

  18. (* The variables are listed in alphabetical order *)

  20. (*
  21.   The name of the identifier representing a variable and its string name
  22.   should be similar. Is there a way to enforce this?
  23. *)

  25. ‌let arguments = Variables.make ("arguments",
  26.   "Arguments passed to executed programs and scripts")

  28. ‌let cwd = Variables.make ("cwd",
  29.   "Used to change current working directory, but not updated")

  31. ‌let commandline = Variables.make ("commandline",
  32.   "Specify the commandline of a tool")

  34. ‌let dst = Variables.make ("dst", "Location where to copy files and directories")

  36. ‌let exit_status = Variables.make ("exit_status",
  37.   "Expected program exit status")

  39. ‌let file = Variables.make ("file",
  40.   "File whose existence should be tested")

  42. ‌let readonly_files = Variables.make ("readonly_files",
  43.   "Files which are only read by the tests")

  45. ‌let make = Variables.make ("MAKE",
  46.   "Command used to invoke make")

  48. ‌let ocamltest_response = Variables.make ("ocamltest_response",
  49.   "File used by hooks to send back information.")

  51. ‌let ocamltest_log = Variables.make ("ocamltest_log",
  52.   "Path to log file for the current test")

  54. ‌let output = Variables.make ("output",
  55.   "Where the output of executing the program is saved")

  57. ‌let program = Variables.make ("program",
  58.   "Name of program produced by ocamlc.byte and ocamlopt.byte")
  59. ‌let program2 = Variables.make ("program2",
  60.   "Name of program produced by ocamlc.opt and ocamlopt.opt")

  62. ‌let promote = Variables.make ("promote",
  63.   "Set to \"true\" to overwrite reference files with the test output")

  65. ‌let reason = Variables.make ("reason",
  66.   "Let a test report why it passed/skipped/failed.")

  68. ‌let reference = Variables.make ("reference",
  69.   "Path of file to which program output should be compared")

  71. ‌let skip_header_lines =
  72.   Variables.make ( "skip_header_lines",
  73.          "The number of lines to skip when comparing program output \
  74.           with the reference file")

  76. let skip_header_bytes =
  77.   Variables.make ( "skip_header_bytes",
  78.          "The number of bytes to skip when comparing program output \
  79.           with the reference file")

  81. let script = Variables.make ("script",
  82.   "External script to run")

  84. let src = Variables.make ("src", "Files and directories to copy")

  86. let stdin = Variables.make ("stdin", "Default standard input")
  87. let stdout = Variables.make ("stdout", "Default standard output")
  88. let stderr = Variables.make ("stderr", "Default standard error")

  90. let subdirectories = Variables.make ("subdirectories",
  91.   "Subdirectories to copy recursively from test source to test build directory")

  93. let test_build_directory = Variables.make ("test_build_directory",
  94.   "Directory for files produced during a test")

  96. let test_build_directory_prefix = Variables.make ("test_build_directory_prefix",
  97.   "Directory under which all test directories should be created")

  99. let test_file = Variables.make ("test_file",
  100.   "Name of file containing the specification of which tests to run")

  102. let test_source_directory = Variables.make ("test_source_directory",
  103.   "Directory containing the test source files")

  105. let test_pass = Variables.make ("TEST_PASS",
  106.   "Exit code to let a script report success")

  108. let test_skip = Variables.make ("TEST_SKIP",
  109.   "Exit code to let a script report skipping")

  111. let test_fail = Variables.make ("TEST_FAIL",
  112.   "Exit code to let a script report failure")

  114. let timeout = Variables.make ("timeout",
  115.   "Maximal execution time for every command (in seconds)")

  117. let _ = List.iter Variables.register_variable
  118.   [
